title: Album Page, "Details of  Campanile Capitals, St. Zeno, Verona", late 19th century
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on textured off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: (inscribed in circle) 102; at bottom right of drawing: Details of Capitals / in Campanile of St Zeno / Verona.
description: Vertical sheet depciting in elevation four columns and capitals.  Two of the columns are shown supporting an arch of regular ashlar blocks.  The cubic or block capitals are Romanesque in style and are decorated with very stylized leaves at the corners and either a bird or small flower in the center above.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Details of  Campanile Capitals, St. Zeno, Verona", late 19th century.Brush and watercolor, graphite on textured off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-36.
